sect1.title: git log
sect1.para: git log. Outputs the commit log of the branch currently in the working directory. Various options allow to customize the level of information given for each commit. It is strongly advised to run this command before pushing to the remote repository, or merging. If the history is too convoluted, it may be necessary to run in order to simplify it. Your co-editors will hate you if you change the history after pushing it.

note.title: Note to Subversion Users
note.para: The ouput is automatically passed to a pager, so that it is not necessary to pipe it to less. Furthermore, no access to the remote repository is needed, so it is ususally much faster to get a long log.
